Entries.default: Among the ashes you find charred fruit pits, scraps of parchment, shards of pottery, animal bones, and matted bundles of singed hair.
You nestle the explosive among the ashes, gently brushing soot and other leavings over it in a discreet mound. The next time the brazier is lit, this will surely explode.
You dig the bomb up from the soot and carefully place it in your pack.
"This relic traveled from the halls of our ancestors." Burapo raises his eyebrows as he notices your interest.
"Whenever I set the flames alight, I see the open mouth of a great eel." Burapo pulls his attention from the ashes and fixes on you.
This copper brazier reeks of ashes and burnt hair. A layer of soot and detritus line the blackened concavity.
Nothing else about the brazier stands out to you as interesting or relevant.
Amid the ashes you perceive a familiar outline - that of a mad, bearded face grimacing with unspent rage.
After taking stock of your inventory of explosives, you must decide which one to plant in the ash.
You step back from the brazier and consider your options.
You search among your belongings, but it doesn't look like anything you possess will get the job done.
"Tangaloa consumes my offerings, I say. He digests them into the hands of the gods."
A passing breeze disturbs a small mound of ashes, swirling them up out of the brazier.
The ashes settle and the breeze gusts no more.
"Ishi has done that a time or two. Hear that, Ishi? You're a messy bird."
